text: dense black smoke billows from what was
a funeral hall packed with civilians at
limps of survivors trying to flee then
this a second strike this video appears
to show how the funeral of one man
became the slaughter of many in the
wreckage a rush to help the victims
bombed as they paid their last respects
to the father of a Houthi rebel official
we came here after the first hit
happened while we are trying to help the
survivors and get the people out the
second hit happened it created the
massacre
rescuers at the scene said the
airstrikes left a lake of blood among
aid workers in Yemen there is revulsion
and shock at the scale of the loss of
life these are huge alarming figures
when the conflict started we used to
have an average of 20 to 30 people
killed but this has been something
really exceptional and something out of
the norm even for what you normally see
in conflict zones
Yemen's conflict escalated in September
2014 when the Houthi rebels who are
allied with Iran seized control of the
capital Sanaa in March last year the
Saudis and their allies began attacking
the Houthis with a controversial bombing
campaign the United Nations says more
than 4,000 civilians have been killed
since then most in airstrikes by the
saudi-led coalition Saudi Arabia has
promised to investigate the strike but
it has acquitted itself in previous
investigations the White House has begun
an immediate review of its support for
the Saudi coalition and in London the
Defense Secretary Michael Fallon said if
civilians were deliberately targeted
British arms sales to Saudi Arabia would
be reviewed orlag Erin BBC News
